# Important Announcements

## Math Minds

-   Math MINDS is open to motivated Channel Islands students enrolled in a B4 Quantitative reasoningÂ course this semester. This FREE transformative program includes:

    -   **A \$350 scholarship award (payable upon completion of the program requirements)**

    -   Four workshops early in the semester to develop your mathematical ability with active learning

        -   Weeks 4 through 8 of the semester

    -   Individualized skill development through a minimum of four one-on-one tutoring sessions with Learning Resource Center tutors

        -   Minimum of **two tutoring sessions** before Week 6 of the semester

        -   Minimum of **two additional tutoring sessions** before Week 12 of the semester

    -   A short asynchronous online course about learning mathematics

    -   Four MasterMINDS Group Check-In Meetings

        -   Weeks 9 through 15 of the semester

    -   Support to build long-lasting strength and confidence in your mathematical ability

    -   A chance to make new friends and strengthen your college journey!

# Statistics Activity

## When do you use statistics?

## What is the difference between math and stats?

## What is variation?


# Generative AI

## Generative AI

The use of generative artificial intelligence (AI) will be prohibited in class. This includes, but not limited to, ChatGPT, Meta AI, and Google Gemini.

## Educational Mislearning

The purpose of this class, and college, is for you to learn about critical thinking skills and perseverance. Using AI will only teach you how to get an answer, which may or may not be correct. 

::: fragment
You will not develop the skills needed to problem solve a challenge. Additionally, developing grit is essential to become successful in college and life. There is no easy way out and AI is an illusion to your success in life.
:::


::: fragment
To learn something, it requires hours of work!
:::


## Stolen Work

Generative AI models were developed with the data from the works by authors, artists, researchers, and many more, who did not consent to have their work to be used this way.

::: fragment
Additionally, all these individuals are not receiving any royalties for the work to be used in creating generative AI models.
:::


::: fragment
[Inside Higher Ed](https://www.insidehighered.com/news/faculty-issues/research/2024/07/29/taylor-francis-ai-deal-sets-worrying-precedent) and [The New Yorker](https://www.newyorker.com/culture/infinite-scroll/is-ai-art-stealing-from-artists) highlight individual's concern of their work being used to train AI models.
:::


## Privacy Concerns

The use of generative AI raises concerns of what data is being harvested from us, possibly without informed consent. 

::: fragment
When you used any large language models, you do not know what information is being harvested from you.
:::

::: fragment
Do you want to upload your thoughts and ideas to a company that can monetize, and possibly exploit.
:::

::: fragment
Does your Professors consent with you uploading their assignments to large language models.
:::

::: fragment
Stanford provided a [report](https://hai.stanford.edu/news/privacy-ai-era-how-do-we-protect-our-personal-information) highlighting the risks of our personal data use in large language models.
:::

## Math 201 Consent

::: fragment
Dr. Isaac Quintanilla Salinas consents in you sharing course material to your friends and family for learning purposes. Use the material to educate and uplift your community.
:::

::: fragment
Dr. Isaac Quintanilla Salinas does not consent in you sharing course material to companies and/or corporations. Additionally, I do not consent in the use of course material for academic dishonesty.
:::

## Negative Environmental Impact

In order to run these large language models, companies need to use a large amounts of energy. This is because large servers are needed to both train and execute a model. 

::: fragment
The [LA Times](https://www.latimes.com/opinion/story/2024-08-15/editorial-generative-ai-is-a-leading-contributor-to-our-energy-consumption-how-will-this-impact-our-climate) reports the potential impact that running AI models in California.
:::

::: fragment
Additionally, [Time](https://time.com/6987773/ai-data-centers-energy-usage-climate-change/) reports that a ChatGPT query uses ten times more energy than a Google search quer, and global AI demands can consume of 1 trillion gallons of water by 2027.
:::

::: fragment
There are also environmental justice questions about where these data centers are constructed.
:::

## Worker Exploitation

The [Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/08/28/scale-ai-remotasks-philippines-artificial-intelligence/) and Time ([Article 1](https://time.com/6147458/facebook-africa-content-moderation-employee-treatment/) and [Article 2](https://time.com/6247678/openai-chatgpt-kenya-workers/)) reported that AI companies utilize "digital sweatshops" to classify data points for model training. 

::: fragment
There is a human cost from the Global South, both financially and mentally, to develop the AI models for users in the United States and Europe.
:::

::: fragment
We must be conscious consumers and demand more from these companies to provide safe working conditions and livable wages.
:::

## How will the Profesor enforce the policy?

::: fragment
I am not! Unless it is extremely obvious, it is extremely difficult to identify AI use.
:::

::: fragment
[Cell](https://www.cell.com/patterns/fulltext/S2666-3899(23)00130-7) has an article indicating that the use of GPT detectors harm non-native English speakers.
:::

## Is Using AI Bad?

::: fragment
NO
:::

::: fragment
What we should do is demand companies to develop these tools in an ethical manner!
:::


## How do I know all this stuff?

::: fragment
![](https://y.yarn.co/747cab9b-9b48-4f39-9a6f-5da4ba440975_text.gif){fig-align="center"}
:::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
